page.title: 11Merdon Manor (2)
page.content: Changes In The Building ======================= The original building was much smaller than it is today , and the main entrance was at the front , not at the side as it is now . The driveway wound in through the woods , and only a faint track now remains . The cellars may be original , but the central buildings are obviously eighteenth century (the house was built in 1559) . In 1920 an extension was added to the West , which was used as servants' quarters . In 1950 a hideous modern extension , with a flat roof , was put on the Eastern side . The present owner , Mr. Jeffrey Smith, roofed this when he aquired the house in 1981 , and it now blends in . He has also built Kennels at the back , added stables and a barn , and transfomed a cow-shed into a garden .
